question_sets.context:
In England, people often talk about the weather because they can have four seasons in one day. In the morning the weather is warm just like in spring. An hour later, clouds come out and then it rains hard. The weather gets a little cold. In the late afternoon the sky will be sunny, and it will be summer.
In England, you can also have summer in winter, or have winter in summer. So in winter you can swim sometimes, and in summer you should(应该,将要) sometimes take warm clothes.
When you go to England, you will see that some English people usually take an umbrella or a raincoat with them on the sunny morning, but you should not laugh at(嘲笑) them. When it rains later, you will laugh yourself.

question_sets.context:
阅读下面短文掌握其大意,并根据首字母提示,完成短文.
I'm Tom. I'm a student in a middle school. Now, l_(1) me say something about my family.
T_(2) five people in my family, my mother, my father, my sister, my brother and I. My father is a worker. My mother is a teacher o_(3) English. We t_(4), my sister, my brother a_(5) I are in the same school. We a_(6) work hard.
My home is at West Hill(西山). There's a river near our h_(7). There're some pear trees and apple trees around the house, b_(8) there aren't any pears and apples on them.
Look! Here a_(9) three cats. One is white, the other two are black and white. We l_(10) them very much.

questions.explanation: The sentence requires the verb 'let' to complete the expression 'let me say'.
The context 'five people' indicates 'There are', which is shortened to 'There're'.
The phrase requires the preposition 'of' to connect 'teacher' and 'English'.
The following sentences talk about three siblings.
The conjunction 'and' is needed to connect 'brother' and 'I'.
The sentence need 'all' to express that 'We all work hard'.
A location should be filled here, which should be 'house'.
Here requires a shift in context, so 'but' is the correct answer.
The sentence is about to introduce some objects, so 'are' is the correct answer.
The writer is about to express his feeling towards the cats, so 'like' is the correct answer.
